modName: Elven Arrow Quiver Wire Mesh Retexture
summary:
Elven Arrow Quiver Wire Mesh Retexture
The elven arrow quiver with a retexture to make the wire mesh texture see through. The included mesh had the arrows  replaced with full lenght arrows you can see though the mesh.
Contents: 1 nif 1 DDS 1 esp 1 bsa
descriptionHtml:
Name: Elven Arrow Quiver Mesh Retexture
Author: Lord Inquisitor
Version: 1.1
Date: 04/03/2011
Cateogry: Modders Resource
Link: None
Homepage: None


===============
Short Description:
===============
Elven Arrow Quiver Wire Mesh Retexture
The elven arrow quiver with a retexture to make the wire mesh texture see through. The included mesh had the arrows  replaced with full lenght arrows you can see though the mesh.

Contents: 
Elvenarrow.nif Arrows made whole so you can see them though mesh
Contents: 1 nif 1 DDS 1 esp 1 bsa

===============
Description:
===============
The elven arrow quiver with a retexture to make the wire mesh texture see through. The included mesh had the arrows  replaced with full lenght arrows you can see though the mesh.

Contents: 
Elvenarrow.nif Arrows made whole so you can see them though mesh

Quiver.dds Alphed to creat mesh like effect.

===============
Update Details:
===============

1.1 added seperate dds - slightly updated
	fixed the bsa
	how to override HiResextures pack issues.
===============
Requirements:
===============

The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim

===============
Install:
===============
Recommended path
1. Extract the files from the archive.
2.Copy files to
Meshes Paths should be:
\\Data\\meshes\\weapons\\elven\\Elvenarrow.nif

Texture Paths should be:
\\Data\\textures\\weapons\\elven\\arrow\\Quiver.dds

OR 
put the 
elvenarrow.esp and elvenarrow.bsa in Data folder and select in launcher.



===============
Hi-Res Tex pack users:
===============

Unclick the HighResTexturePack01.esp and HighResTexturePack01.esp from the launcher OR just add an X to the file type so HighResTexturePack01.esp becomes HighResTexturePack01.espX. This allows for replacer textures to work without being forcefully wiped out by the High Res Texture packs.
If it whines on loading its because it can\'t now override your textures.

change your \"Skyrim.ini\" to read this
[Archive]
sResourceArchiveList=Skyrim - Misc.bsa, Skyrim - Shaders.bsa, Skyrim - Textures.bsa, Skyrim - Interface.bsa, Skyrim - Animations.bsa, Skyrim - Meshes.bsa, Skyrim - Sounds.bsa, HighResTexturePack01.bsa, HighResTexturePack02.bsa
sResourceArchiveList2=Skyrim - Voices.bsa, Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa

Skyrim.ini is found in C:\\Users\\Documents\\My Games folder

===============
Un-Install:
===============

1. Delete the folders associated with the mod

===============
Compatibility:
===============

No compatiblity issues so far.

===============
Bugs/Issues:
===============

No known issues so far, please let me know if you find any.

===============
History:
===============

1.0 03/03/2012 - Initial Release


===============
Contact:
===============
Lord Inquisitor 
On Nexus
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=872676
on Fookunity
http://www.fookunity.com/forum/member.php?u=1848

===============
Recommended Mods:
===============

None

===============
Credits:
===============

Thanks to Bethesda  for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to InsanitySorrow for ReadMe Generator this readme is based on.

===============
Tools Used:
===============

Blender 3D 2.49
Nifskope 1.1.0
Paintshop Rro 5.06
Fallout 3 ReadMe Generator

===============
License/Legal:
===============

Use for your mods, but send me a download link to your mod if its released or post it in commments. So I can see what you did. I like seeing where my stuff is used in.


This file is provided as is and the author holds no responsiblity for anything that may come to happen from using this file.
